title: Linux vnstat Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the powerful Linux vnstat command for monitoring network traffic. Learn how to install, configure, and generate reports to visualize your network data.

verify.name: Verify vnstat installation
verify.hint: The vnstat command should return version 2.6. Please check the output of `sudo vnstat --version` and ensure it matches the expected version.

verify.name: Verify vnstat network monitoring
verify.hint: The `sudo vnstat -i eth0` command should display the network traffic statistics for the `eth0` interface. Please check the output and ensure it contains the "rx" (received) and "tx" (transmitted) values.

steps.title: Generate Reports and Visualize Network Data with vnstat

verify.name: Verify vnstat report generation
verify.hint: The `sudo vnstati -i eth0 -o eth0_report.png` command should generate a PNG image file named `eth0_report.png` in the current directory. Please check if the file exists.
